titles.title: To amend the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit bills and joint resolutions from containing more than one subject.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Amends rule XXI of the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit any bill, resolution, or amendment that contains more than a single subject from being received or considered in the House. Permits a question of order to be raised at any time on the number of subjects in a measure or amendment. Requires the single subject to be expressed in the measure's title. Makes an exception for legislation that complies, consolidates, revises, or rearranges the statutory law.
